canard_pc.title: Découvrez le Cri du lapin, la newsletter de Canard PC
canard_pc.author: La Rédaction

technologyreview.title: The three challenges keeping cars from being fully autonomous
technologyreview.description: Technical, regulatory, and business obstacles are still in the way of safe, useful, and affordable self-driving vehicles.

technologyreview.title: Ready for 6G? How AI will shape the network of the future
technologyreview.description: With 5G networks rolling out around the world, engineers are turning their attention to the next incarnation.

technologyreview.title: Landowners are earning millions for carbon cuts that may not occur
technologyreview.description: A new analysis finds California’s cap-and-trade program may vastly overestimate emissions reductions.

technologyreview.title: Facebook’s ad-serving algorithm discriminates by gender and race
technologyreview.description: Even if an advertiser is well-intentioned, the algorithm still prefers certain groups of people over others.

technologyreview.title: The race to make a lab-grown steak
technologyreview.description: Meat production spews tons of greenhouse gas and uses up too much land and water. Is there an alternative that won’t make us do without?

technologyreview.title: China’s Huawei has big ambitions to weaken the US grip on AI leadership
technologyreview.description: In spite of tensions with the US and its allies, Huawei is rapidly building a suite of AI offerings unmatched by any other company on the planet.

technologyreview.title: A simple blood test to predict premature births could save babies’ lives
technologyreview.description: Complications from preterm birth are the leading cause of death worldwide in children under five.

technologyreview.title: Bill Gates explains why we should all be optimists
technologyreview.description:
We sat down to talk about breakthrough technologies, China, 
and reasons to be cheerful with this issue’s guest editor.

technologyreview.title: 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2019, curated by Bill Gates
technologyreview.description: We asked Gates to choose this year’s list of inventions that will change the world for the better.

technologyreview.title: Why AI is a threat to democracy—and what we can do to stop it
technologyreview.description: Futurist and NYU professor Amy Webb on an impending artificial intelligence catastrophe—and why there’s still hope it can be averted.

technologyreview.title: China’s CRISPR twins might have had their brains inadvertently enhanced
technologyreview.description: New research suggests that a controversial gene-editing experiment to make children resistant to HIV may also have enhanced their ability to learn and form memories.

technologyreview.title: The first privately funded trip to the moon is about to launch
technologyreview.description: After failing to claim the Lunar X Prize (which, to be fair, everyone did), the Israeli firm SpaceIL could have a rover on lunar soil in a little over a month.

technologyreview.title: The technology behind OpenAI’s fiction-writing, fake-news-spewing AI, explained
technologyreview.description: The language model can write like a human, but it doesn’t have a clue what it’s saying.

technologyreview.title: AI is reinventing the way we invent
technologyreview.description: The biggest impact of artificial intelligence will be to help humans make discoveries we couldn’t make on our own.

technologyreview.title: Never mind killer robots—here are six real AI dangers to watch out for in 2019
technologyreview.description: Last year a string of controversies revealed a darker (and dumber) side to artificial intelligence.

technologyreview.title: The Reunion: a new science-fiction story about surveillance in China
technologyreview.description: Technology is making people unhinged and violent. Can an algorithm stop them?

technologyreview.title: Seven New Year’s resolutions for Big Tech in 2019
technologyreview.description: 2018 was a no good, very bad year for Silicon Valley. Here’s some of the things tech giants should commit to do next year to avoid a repeat performance.

technologyreview.title: The day I tasted climate change
technologyreview.description: Every one of us will have a moment when global warming gets personal.

technologyreview.title: All the reasons 2018 was a breakout year for DNA data
technologyreview.description: Gene information on millions of people is revolutionizing how we predict disease, catch criminals, and find new drugs.

technologyreview.title: How Google took on China—and lost
technologyreview.description: It used to be that while Google wanted China, China really needed Google. Not any more.
